choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
in javascript how do you save to and read back from localstorage

### Response:


To save data to localStorage in JavaScript, you can use the following code:

```javascript
localStorage.setItem("key", "value");
```

To retrieve data from localStorage, you can use the following code:

```javascript
const key = "key";
const value = localStorage.getItem(key);
console.log(value);
```

Please note that localStorage is a read-only storage mechanism, so you cannot modify data stored in it using JavaScript.
